channel.title: Can't resolve to variable

item.title: Can't resolve to variable
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

You shouldn’t be using a break statement outside of a switch statement or to stop loops. I don’t think you can even use a break statement in an if-statement.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't resolve to variable
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

For your sake, (I think I see it) I want you to try and use debugging, like this:

public static int getMysteryItem = (int) (Math.random() * (mysteryBoxItems.length)); { if (item = 1234) { c.sendMessage("getMysteryItem: "+getMysteryItem); addItem(getMysteryItem, 1); break; } }
If that won’t send you a message then you have an issue with your if statement.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't resolve to variable
item.dc:creator: @Learning_Code Learning Code
item.description:
@Learning_Code wrote:

I don’t know what’s wrong with this code.

Revision 718

public static int getMysteryItem = (int) (Math.random() * (mysteryBoxItems.length)); { if (item = 1234) { addItem(getMysteryItem, 1); break; } }

Read full topic
